text: The FIFA U-17 World Championship 1997 was a tournament. It was the seventh version of the tournament. It was in the cities of Cairo, Ismailia, Alexandria, and Port Said in Egypt. The tournaments were between 4 September and 21 September 1997. Players born after 1 January 1980 could join this tournament. == Venues == Cairo Port Said Alexandria Ismailia Cairo International Stadium Port Said Stadium Alexandria Stadium Ismailia Stadium Capacity: 74,100 Capacity: 22,000 Capacity: 20,000 Capacity: 16,500 == Teams == Confederation Qualifying Tournament Qualifier(s) AFC (Asia) 1996 AFC U-17 Championship CAF (Africa) Host nation 1997 African U-17 Championship CONCACAF (North, Central America & Caribbean) 1996 CONCACAF U-17 Championship CONMEBOL (South America) 1997 South American U-17 Championship OFC (Oceania) 1997 OFC U-17 Qualifying Tournament UEFA (Europe) 1997 UEFA European Under-16 Championship == Matches == === Group A === Team 3 2 1 0 5 1 4 7 3 1 2 0 5 4 1 5 3 1 1 1 7 4 3 4 3 0 0 3 4 12 -8 0 \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- === Group B === Team 3 3 0 0 17 2 15 9 3 2 0 1 7 2 5 6 3 1 0 2 8 6 2 3 3 0 0 3 0 22 -22 0 \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- === Group C === Team 3 3 0 0 13 1 12 9 3 2 0 1 8 4 4 6 3 1 0 2 4 7 -3 3 3 0 0 3 1 14 -13 0 \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- === Group D === Team 3 2 1 0 7 1 6 7 3 2 1 0 3 0 3 7 3 1 0 2 4 8 -4 3 3 0 0 3 1 6 -5 0 \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- == Knockout stage == {{Round8-with third |14 September - Alexandria|31=21 September - Cairo|24=|25=4|26=18 September - Cairo|27=|28=2|29=|30=1 |32=|22=|33=2|34=|35=1 |36=21 September - Cairo|37=|38=2|39=|23=0|21=18 September - Ismailia||10=0 (3)|2||0|14 September - Cairo||0 (4)||11=15 September - Port Said|20=1 |12=|13=4|14=|15=1|16=15 September - Ismailia|17=|18=2|19=|40=1}} === Quarterfinals === \---- \---- \---- === Semifinals === \---- === Playoff for 3rd place === === Final === == Result == == Goalscorers == David of Spain won the Golden Shoe award.
